definition: to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: Some people's fear of marriage can be traced back to their parents' divorce. ;
sentences.chinese: 一些人對婚姻的驚駭可以追溯到他們怙恃的仳離。

sentences.english: As someone once said, nothing astounds people more.
sentences.chinese: 就像有人說的，沒有什麼事能令人異常驚駭。

sentences.english: The passengers were rather appalled to see that their ship was about to go under.
sentences.chinese: 乘客們看到他們的船快要沉了都驚駭不已。

sentences.english: Fearfulness and trembling have come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.
sentences.chinese: 恐懼讓我渾身發抖，驚駭已經淹沒了我。

sentences.english: And he watches in horror as his car goes over a cliff.
sentences.chinese: 他驚駭地看着他的車衝進了懸崖。

sentences.english: Lady Capulet looked down and stared at Juliet in horror.
sentences.chinese: 卡布利特夫人往下看，然後驚駭地凝視茱麗葉。

sentences.english: The traveller thrilled us with his stories.
sentences.chinese: 這位旅行者的經歷使我們驚駭不已。

sentences.english: Something Wicked This Way Comes. Ray Bradbury. Perhaps the subtlest horror story ever written.
sentences.chinese: 也許這是曾經被寫過的最精妙的驚駭故事。

sentences.english: A video showed her braying in terror and confusion.
sentences.chinese: 一段視頻記錄了他的驚駭嘶鳴。

sentences.english: This was a nasty attack and the woman is still very shocked.
sentences.chinese: 這是一次惡意襲擊，那女人仍然驚駭不已。

sentences.english: Then you send dreams to me, and visions of fear;
sentences.chinese: 你就用夢驚駭我，用異象恐嚇我。

sentences.english: They that come after him shall be astonied at his day, as they that went before were affrighted.
sentences.chinese: 以後來的要驚奇他的日子，好像以前去的受了驚駭。

sentences.english: He used fear and terror to stay in power.
sentences.chinese: 他利用人們的敬畏和驚駭維持統治。

sentences.english: What are the convulsions of a city in comparison with the insurrections of the soul?
sentences.chinese: 一個城市的痙攣和靈魂的驚駭比較起來，算得了什麼？

sentences.english: The letter voice tremble to sink and sound to make people frightened.
sentences.chinese: 阿信嗓音抖沉，聽起來讓人驚駭。

sentences.english: The traveler thrilled us with his stories.
sentences.chinese: 這位旅行者的經歷使我們驚駭不已。

definition: overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
